page.title: 16EGMANTON PILGRIMAGES
page.content: Religion in Britain takes many forms. On Saturday 17th August 1985 some hundred or so people gathered in Egmanton Church. They were making a pilgrimage to the church which contains the Shrine of our Lady of Egmanton. The Patron of the church is one of the Catholic societies of the Church of England. One of its objectives is "The promotion and maintenance of Catholic teaching and practice." The pilgrimages are run by the "Society of our Lady of Egmanton". Very few villagers are involved except in providing refreshments for the visitors. Most village people do not appreciate the historical significance of this very high church event. Comper's reconstruction figure of Mother and Child is paraded around the village.
